query: Q1. You open a nested sequence in order to trim the length of a clip. You make the total duration of the clips longer. What happens to the duration of the nest in the main sequence?
options:
Nothing, the nest duration remains the same in the original sequence.
 The duration of the nest changes and an overwrite edit pushes the remaining clips to make room.
 The clips change speed to match the duration of the nest.
 The duration of the nest changes and a ripple edit pushes the remaining clips to make room.

query: Q2. What is a good reason to use a nested sequence?
options:
Nesting improves playback performance.
 Nesting makes it easier to reduce clutter in the Project panel, saving time and potentially project budget.
 Nesting allows a single effect to be applied to everything that is inside the nest, like a color correction or a video limiter.
 Nesting helps Adobe Premiere Pro render faster.

query: Q3. What happens on your hard drive when you create a subclip?
options:
Nothing, since a subclip does not create a new media file on your hard drive.
 A pointer file is created on your hard drive.
 A new master clip is created on your hard drive and added to the project.
 A new media file is created next to the original media.

query: Q4. Which statement is _false_ regarding exporting media from Adobe Premiere Pro?
options:
Adobe Premiere can directly export files.
 You can encode sequences into one or more formats with Adobe Media Encoder.
 While using Adobe Media Encoder, you can keep working on the same sequence in Adobe Premiere Pro.
 When you click Export, Adobe Premiere Pro will encode the file in the background and let you continue editing.

query: Q5. While working in Premiere Pro, how can you quickly create a new After Effects composition with settings that match the current sequence?
options:
Select File > Adobe Dynamic Link > Import After Effects Composition.
 Import a project from After Effects and choose Match project size when importing.
 Select File > Adobe Dynamic Link > New After Effects Composition.
 Switch to After Effects and manually set up the project for accuracy.

query: Q6. Which is NOT a tag available in the Essential Sound panel?
options:
Narration
 SFX
 Ambience
 Music

query: Q7. HSL secondary color correction allows you to adjust which of the following? (Select three items.)
code:
markdown
A. Clarity
B. Contrast
C. Saturation
D. Temperature
E. Blur
options:
B, C, D
 A, B, C
 B, D, E
 A, C, E

query: Q8. What is the only panel in which the Rate Stretch tool can modify a clip?
options:
Program Monitor panel

query: Q10. In which panel do you assemble media in order to create sequence?
options:
Timeline panel

query: Q11. Which panel allows you to modify video effects after they have been applied to a clip?
options:
Effects panel

query: Q12. Suppose your clips link to media files stored in multiple locations. You want to have the media files in a single location in their current format. Which option should you choose in the Project Manager?
options:
Exclude Unused Clips
 Consolidate and Transcode
 Collect Files and Copy to New Location
 Create New Trimmed Project

query: Q13. What is the default video transition in Adobe Premiere Pro?
options:
film dissolve
 additive dissolve
 cross dissolve
 impact dissolve

query: Q14. Which term describes the algorithm that is used to encode and decode a video file?
options:
container
 format
 compressor
 codec

options:
Intensity

options:

source monitor

query: Q29. Which formats does Adobe Media Encoder support? (Select three items.)
code:
markdown
A. GIF
B. DCP
C. QuickTime
D. HEVC
E. FLV
options:
A, B, C

markdown
A. AVCHD
B. HEVC

D. MXF OP1a

options:

query: Q31. If you have placed a GPU-accelerated effect on a clip in the Timeline and have not rendered it, what color appears at the top of your Timeline?
options:
red
 blue
 yellow
 green

query: Q32. Which statement is true about the Appearance preferences?
options:
The default brightness is the halfway position between darker and lighter.
 You can set the top bar of windows to a custom accent color.
 You can adjust the intensity of the Focus Indicator to help easily identify which window is active.
 You can change the highlight color.

query: Q34. Your project has several sequences that are no longer needed. How would you use the Project Manager to produce a new version of the project that excludes the unwanted sequences?
options:
Deselect the unwanted sequences in the Sequence area.
 Select Create New Trimmed Project.
 Select Consolidate and Transcode.
 Choose Collect Files and Copy to New Location.

query: Q48. To quickly arrange the panels in Adobe Premiere Pro for a specific task, what do you use?
options:
workspaces
 layouts
 panel presets
 events
